reviewText: This was a good pilates video. I have purchased numerous exercise videos, and this is one I like. Rael emphasizes correct posture of the poses which is good too. I am strong, so it wasn't greatly challenging, but I do feel like it gives me a good pilates workout. I am glad I purchased this video and will use it often.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the best Pilates dvd I've ever found. Rael's cueing is fantastic. You will definitely work hard during this workout and he gives lots of modifications to up the ante as you improve.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really like this workout video.  It leaves me feeling both physically and mentally relaxed, which is what a good workout should do. Rael Pilates is a thorough and comprehensive pilates workout.  Rael provides effective form cues for the most part but for some reason never explains the Pilates stance with hips rotated externally. I like how he provides a few minutes of warmup and incorporates some yoga moves such as down dog and child's pose. Be aware that there are some advanced Pilates exercises, which if you are beginning you may want to skip.
summary: Not for the faint of heart
Title: N/A

reviewText: This disc comes with a 5 min interview with Rael, comes in 5.1 sound, the music is not annoying & the director & producers have won golden globes, emmys, etc. for other tv shows. The workout is 25 min long.Rael Isacowitz has been doing Pilates for 25 years, is one of the few who can perform the entire repertoire & teaches other pilates teachers. He's one of the only people who can do the entire workout & has a masters in dance which shows in how he moves & speaks. He is very graceful when he moves, has a lot of charisma when he speaks & doesn't miss anything when showing how to do the movements. He sees the body as a dancer & is amazing in knowing how the body responds to small differences in movements such as which way the palm should face.The set is simple orange with Rael guiding & speaking with an in shape female in gym halter top & pants doing the movements on a pilates table. Rael tells you how to move, what to watch out for all while keeping perfect pace of always telling you when to inhale & exhale in charming manner that's never annoying. He also demonstrates the more advanced way of doing each movement w/perfect precision & grace, even the roll ups. The pace is relaxed to emphasis body awareness.Some of the movements are: breathing, pelvic curl/yoga bridge pose, lying spinal twist (knees tucked), chest lift (crunch), hundreds, roll up (laying to sitting), leg circles, rolling like a ball, single leg stretch,  criss cross legs ab workout, double leg stretch, shoulder bridge, spine stretch (sitting), saw (touching each foot opposite hand), sitting spinal twist, corkscrew, side leg lifts (lying down), adductor squeeze, oblique arch, swan (yoga cobra/upward dog), single leg kick, double leg kick, cat/cow stretch, leg pull front, hip flexor stretch, back support (toning), single leg teaser, seal puppy & child's pose relaxation.Only a few of the moves I felt were easy, but the more advanced way was plenty challenge enough for me.If you want to learn pilates from a real master & get true body awareness to avoid spams & muscle injury, get this dvd.You can see trailers for his system 17 & 27 at collagevideo com & get more info at raelilates com
summary: The Best Pilates workout for toning & stetching

reviewText: This is a really good workout.  It mainly focuses on your core (abs) and after a couple of days, I could definitely feel the burn.  I have been doing other pilates videos for about 5 month, and this is a good step up from them.  I really feel the burn after the workout.  I would definitely recommend.  I am looking forward to seeing results on my abs.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was Surprised how good this dvd is , it is the cheapest pilates dvd I've bought (on DDD) yet it's the best in my opinion and my favorite now. The production quality is great and the picture is widescreen, it's from the same production team of the "Total Yoga" series which I also recommend.This is the third level and the most advanced in his pilates system series but it's not the most advanced pilates dvd you can find , in fact I'd say its good even for intermediate (and advanced) pilates students in good shape.It's a challenging yet doable workout and primarily focuses on the powerhouse( not alot upper or lower body work) .There's no super advanced pilates exercises on this one but the workout flows great , rael's instruction is motivating and straightforwardThe workout starts with sufficient warm up of basic pilates movements like ab curls and bridge also through the workout there's a few stretches and downward dogs and some relaxation in the end , something that more pilates videos should have!for a video clip  check collagevideo.comand for more reviews videofitness.com
Title: N/A
